clinical_study.brief_title: Phase 2 Study of Reltecimod vs Placebo in Patients With Sepsis-associated Acute Kidney Injury
clinical_study.official_title: Phase 2 Randomized, Double-blind Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of Reltecimod as Compared to Placebo in Addition to Standard of Care in Patients With Sepsis-associated Acute Kidney Injury (SA-AKI)

brief_summary.textblock: Phase 2 multicenter study to be conducted in up to 50 qualified participating sites in the United States to assess the efficacy and safety of Reltecimod vs placebo in patients with abdominal sepsis-associated Stage 2/3 AKI.

detailed_description.textblock: Phase 2 randomized, placebo controlled study assessing the efficacy (complete recovery from AKI) and safety of Reltecimod in patients with suspected or confirmed abdominal sepsis (planned or completed surgical (laparotomy or laparoscopy) or interventional radiologic procedures for control of underlying abdominal infection within 12 hours of evaluation by medical personnel), requiring intensive care unit (ICU) admission and in whom the diagnosis of Stage 2/3 acute kidney injury (AKI; as defined by Kidney Disease Improving Global Outcomes (KDIGO) criteria) is established at initial presentation for medical evaluation or up to 48 hours from the suspected diagnosis of abdominal sepsis.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: 1:1 randomization of study drug (Reltecimod) and placebo (normal saline)
study_design_info.masking_description: Sponsor personnel and CRAs will also be blinded to study treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Complete Recovery from Stage 2/3 Acute Kidney Injury at Day 14
primary_outcome.description: To compare the rates of complete recovery (alive, free of dialysis and return of serum creatinine to <150% of reference baseline; equivalent to acute kidney disease (AKD) category 0) at Day 14 between the Reltecimod-treated patients and the placebo-treated patients

secondary_outcome.description: Tabulate number of patients with treatment emergent adverse events and serious adverse events as well as those with laboratory abnormalities. Compare rates in Reltecimod-treated patients to placebo patients.

secondary_outcome.measure: Complete Recovery from AKI at Day 28
secondary_outcome.description: To compare the rates of complete recovery (alive, free of dialysis and return of serum creatinine to <150% of reference baseline; equivalent to acute kidney disease (AKD) category 0) at Day 28 between the Reltecimod-treated patients and the placebo-treated patients
To compare the rates of overall recovery defined as complete recovery or partial recovery at Days 14 and 28, respectively between Reltecimod and placebo-treated patients
To compare time to complete recovery from AKI between the Reltecimod and placebo-treated patients
To compare time to overall recovery from AKI between the Reltecimod and placebo-treated patients

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of AKI Stages in Abdominal Sepsis
secondary_outcome.description: Tabulate the number of patients with abdominal sepsis who have Stages 1, 2 and 3 AKI (using the KDIGO criteria)
To compare survival status at Days 14 and 28 between the Reltecimod and placebo-treated patients

intervention.description: Single IV administration of 0.5 mg/kg Reltecimod (at a concentration of 1 mg/mL)
Single IV administration of 0.5 mL/kg of 0.9% saline (volume equivalent with Reltecimod dosing schema)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Has either suspected or documented diagnosis of abdominal sepsis requiring treatment with parenteral antibiotics and planned or completed surgical (laparotomy or laparoscopy) or interventional radiologic procedures within 12 hours of evaluation by medical personnel.
2. Initial diagnosis of AKI Stage 2 or 3 according to KDIGO AKI criteria established either upon presentation to medical care in those patients with suspected abdominal sepsis or in those patients in whom the initial diagnosis of AKI is established during the 48 hour period from the suspected diagnosis of abdominal sepsis.
3. Study medication must be administered within 6 hours of confirmation of onset of AKI
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Has known prior history of CKD with a documented estimated GFR (eGFR) < 30 mL/min
2. Patients receiving RRT for chronic kidney disease
3. Patients that are treated with RRT for acute kidney dysfunction, starting prior to study drug administration or in whom there is an immediate plan to initiate RRT upon diagnosis of AKI
4. Previously diagnosed with documented AKI in the last 30 days
5. Documented primary glomerular disease or toxic tubulo-interstitial nephritis at the time of AKI diagnosis
6. Patient is not expected to survive throughout 28 days of study due to significant underlying medical condition
7. Pregnant or lactating women
8. Concurrent or previous enrollment in a clinical trial involving investigational drug or a medical device
